name: The Beauty of Autism
description: Mom. Advocate. Traveler. Dreamer. Voice for my adult child, Brittany, who lives with classic autism. #ASD #Autism

tweet: Britt is grumpy today. Woke in a great mood, but suddenly...not so great mood. No apparent reason: Sick? Routine change? Tired? Sad? Depressed? In pain? Disappointed? Frustrated? Or...autism? #ASD #Autism

name: The Beauty of Autism
description: Mom. Advocate. Traveler. Dreamer. Voice for my adult child, Brittany, who lives with classic autism. #ASD #Autism
tweet: Went swimming in the Gulf red tide again & realize the days of me being able to tolerate it is behind me. My allergic reaction (eyes) SEVERE. Pool tomorrow. We have to break the news to Britt tonight. I think she'll be fine w/it since we have alternate activity in place. #Autism

name: The Beauty of Autism
description: Mom. Advocate. Traveler. Dreamer. Voice for my adult child, Brittany, who lives with classic autism. #ASD #Autism
tweet: @LaurieMit We never take her anywhere without letting her know where she's going. That would make her more anxious and confused than she normally is. She must know exactly what's going on.

name: The Beauty of Autism
description: Mom. Advocate. Traveler. Dreamer. Voice for my adult child, Brittany, who lives with classic autism. #ASD #Autism
tweet: @LaurieMit She'll typically do anything you ask as long as she's well prepared. Example: Let's say we told her she's going for ice cream, but instead go to the park, that can be a total disaster, even though she loves the parks! Then she would resist...big time!

name: The Beauty of Autism
description: Mom. Advocate. Traveler. Dreamer. Voice for my adult child, Brittany, who lives with classic autism. #ASD #Autism
tweet: @LaurieMit If its something she's done before & liked, she'll usually cooperate if given advance notice. If it's something new, we give her plenty of advanced notice, visual & verbal cues to prepare her. The costume thing she didn't like, but tolerated. Overall, she likes to do activities.

name: The Beauty of Autism
description: Mom. Advocate. Traveler. Dreamer. Voice for my adult child, Brittany, who lives with classic autism. #ASD #Autism
tweet: They can keep changing the terminology to be more inclusive & PC. The bottom line is, if your child has classic autism, you & they, are in this for life. Semantics does't change reality. Autism is lifelong & will challenge the caretaker & person with autism daily, if not hourly.

name: The Beauty of Autism
description: Mom. Advocate. Traveler. Dreamer. Voice for my adult child, Brittany, who lives with classic autism. #ASD #Autism
tweet:
Age Limit for Autism Development

Older children, teens, and adults do not develop autism. In fact, to qualify for an autism spectrum diagnosis, you must have symptoms that appear during early childhood (i.e., before age 3).

name: The Beauty of Autism
description: Mom. Advocate. Traveler. Dreamer. Voice for my adult child, Brittany, who lives with classic autism. #ASD #Autism
tweet: @and_kell @autcareandshare Agree! Britt is 30yo & I'm still learning how to help her navigate her world. Daily. Exception: any suggestion that applies to typical learners. I tune them out since Britt is nowhere near a typical learner.  If Britt was a typical learner, I wouldn't be here discussing autism!

name: The Beauty of Autism
description: Mom. Advocate. Traveler. Dreamer. Voice for my adult child, Brittany, who lives with classic autism. #ASD #Autism
tweet: @jayhood73 They get set in their ways & glued to their routines. Changing routine can be a disaster. When they're full-grown & stronger-more challenging. We give Britt a month"s notice, visual daily reminders & reassurance that routine will resume next day. We have to tell/show 100's of x's

name: The Beauty of Autism
description: Mom. Advocate. Traveler. Dreamer. Voice for my adult child, Brittany, who lives with classic autism. #ASD #Autism
tweet: @Gubb1e I agree it's not a conscious decision. We had to help my daughter dig deep, to control her impulses (always a work in progress). When you have an adult that is flipping-out anytime things don't go her way, it goes from delving into the conscious intent to a desperate situation.

name: The Beauty of Autism
description: Mom. Advocate. Traveler. Dreamer. Voice for my adult child, Brittany, who lives with classic autism. #ASD #Autism
tweet: @Gubb1e If explosive behavior gets you your way, it will become THE means to an end. Since they're not always 6yo & 45Lbs, developing self-regulation & coping skills is a healthier target. It can takes years of consistency to work. My daughter is 30yo & it still has to be reinforced.

name: The Beauty of Autism
description: Mom. Advocate. Traveler. Dreamer. Voice for my adult child, Brittany, who lives with classic autism. #ASD #Autism
tweet: @and_kell She was very matter of fact about the shot with the preservative being the culprit. My assumption is that it was from yellow fever shot I had the same time. The Flu shot still has mercury. My guess is the Covid shot will as well. Shots we gave our babies had it too. #Autism

name: The Beauty of Autism
description: Mom. Advocate. Traveler. Dreamer. Voice for my adult child, Brittany, who lives with classic autism. #ASD #Autism
tweet: @and_kell When I called the travel clinic that gave me the booster to tell them I had an adverse reaction, nurse was very matter of fact about it, as if she hears it all the time. She said it was from the Thimerosal (mercury) in the tetanus shot (I had several shots that day for a trip)

name: The Beauty of Autism
description: Mom. Advocate. Traveler. Dreamer. Voice for my adult child, Brittany, who lives with classic autism. #ASD #Autism
tweet: @and_kell I took a tetanus booster about 10yrs ago. Within an hour of it, I was out cold in a Walgreens parking lot (I was frantically trying to buy Benadryl, as I was having an intense itching reaction). 911 was called. Later learned that Tetanus shots are laced with mercury(preservative)

tweet: @BeckyWhin @ja54kki The swab is faster & less painful then a blood draw. Also, they can't see it happening which is helpful. It takes about 30 seconds. Have a person on both sides holding her hand & distracting so she can't grab at the swab.

name: The Beauty of Autism
description: Mom. Advocate. Traveler. Dreamer. Voice for my adult child, Brittany, who lives with classic autism. #ASD #Autism
tweet: @ja54kki @BeckyWhin Britt had the newer version (rapid test, not as deep) nasal swab. The nurse was careful, gentle & fast with her. By the time  Britt  knew it felt weird, it was over. Good luck!

name: The Beauty of Autism
description: Mom. Advocate. Traveler. Dreamer. Voice for my adult child, Brittany, who lives with classic autism. #ASD #Autism
tweet:
Can you develop autism later in life?
Age Limit for Autism Development

Older children, teens, and adults do not develop autism. In fact, to qualify for an autism spectrum diagnosis, you must have symptoms that appear during early childhood (i.e., before age 3).

tweet: "It is important to take the time to analyze these underlying causes of aggressive behavior in your child with autism. By understanding the triggers of aggression, you will be able to choose the most effective intervention strategies." #Autism #Agression #ASD

tweet: "Functional behavioral analysis reveals that behavior occurs for two primary reasons: to gain access to something we want, or to get out of or away from something we do not want. " #Autism #ASD #

name: The Beauty of Autism
description: Mom. Advocate. Traveler. Dreamer. Voice for my adult child, Brittany, who lives with classic autism. #ASD #Autism
tweet: @and_kell Sometimes it takes people outside their circle to notice! I had several kids the same age in our neighborhood that we're together a lot, so I started to see at 2yo, their development & behaviors were looking very different. Regression began.

name: The Beauty of Autism
description: Mom. Advocate. Traveler. Dreamer. Voice for my adult child, Brittany, who lives with classic autism. #ASD #Autism
tweet: @and_kell Yes, hard to fathom they can't speak. They look as normal as anybody else, but profoundly different. Britt's receptive language is very poor unless it's something she knows well such as when I told her to pick her head up/down. She LOVES the camera, so she knows these words...

name: The Beauty of Autism
description: Mom. Advocate. Traveler. Dreamer. Voice for my adult child, Brittany, who lives with classic autism. #ASD #Autism
tweet: @and_kell Britt had normally developing speech until about 2yr, 3mo. At that time static, than began  losing words. Last word she ever said was at 4yo..."mom." Not a word since, in 26yrs...

name: The Beauty of Autism
description: Mom. Advocate. Traveler. Dreamer. Voice for my adult child, Brittany, who lives with classic autism. #ASD #Autism
tweet: @and_kell We're outside, by salt water/air & a breeze. It's not like we look sickly or coughing. They act like we have Ebola & are are bleeding from the eyes as they walk past. As I sad earlier, Karen got VERY testy w/us. I feel if you're that paranoid, YOU walk on the busy road.

name: The Beauty of Autism
description: Mom. Advocate. Traveler. Dreamer. Voice for my adult child, Brittany, who lives with classic autism. #ASD #Autism
tweet: @and_kell It is! I get to see the worse of the fear on those daily walks. It's obnoxious at this point! The old guy almost lost his life and/or independence trying to walk 6' from us...outside, in a cool breeze. Are you kidding me...

name: The Beauty of Autism
description: Mom. Advocate. Traveler. Dreamer. Voice for my adult child, Brittany, who lives with classic autism. #ASD #Autism
tweet: @autismafter18 It was sad to see. He hit the ground hard. Walking is become an issue for people that are fanatic about staying 6p' away. Walking on the road w/Britt isn't optional, but I'm willing to walk past people on the sidewalk.  If not, we  would stay home. #SocialDistancing

name: The Beauty of Autism
description: Mom. Advocate. Traveler. Dreamer. Voice for my adult child, Brittany, who lives with classic autism. #ASD #Autism
tweet: Another person walking last night wanted us to move into the road. She pulled an obnoxious Karen on us. If you want to walk 6' away, YOU walk on the busy road, walk at 2am, or stay home. End of story. #caronavirus2020

name: The Beauty of Autism
description: Mom. Advocate. Traveler. Dreamer. Voice for my adult child, Brittany, who lives with classic autism. #ASD #Autism
tweet: Britt, support, ğŸ¶, & I waking on sidewalk last night. Elderly couple approached in opposite direction. In order to stay 6' away from us outside on a breezy evening, they chose to walk onto busy road. Man lost footing & fell on his face. Scene disturbing on many levels. He's ok.
